intro: Orthocarpus purpurascens var. multicaulis, commonly known as the purple-flowered orthocarpus, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, characterized by its umbellate inflorescence and aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows in moist, temperate regions and is known for its striking purple flowers. Its leaves are pinnately divided and often have a distinctive, slightly hairy texture. This variety is notable for its multiple stems, which contribute to its common name "multicaulis."
